name: Taiko no Tatsujin: Pop Tap Beat
text: Try your hand at the review of Taiko no Tatsujin: Pop Tap Beat was really fun: available for free for Apple Arcade subscribers, the latest episode of the famous rhythm series produced by Bandai Namco brings all the colorful solidity of its formula to iOS devices arcade, and it works damn well. Without aiming at particular structures or prize systems for unlocking songs, the game puts all its firepower into play right away, with a tracklist consisting of over thirty songs and divided into categories: Pop, Anime, VOCALOID Music, Other, Classical, Video Games and Namco Originals. To these is also added an online multiplayer mode in which two users can challenge each other in parallel on the same track, selected randomly: obviously whoever scores the highest score wins. Gameplay Taiko no Tatsujin: Pop Tap Beat is a party of patterns and colors. Son of the long experience gained in Japanese arcades, the gameplay of Taiko no Tatsujin: Pop Tap Beat proves to be extremely simple and immediate from the very first ... lines. Following the rhythm of the musical pieces, we will have to drum on the screen in different ways, as indicated by each note: central tap (~don~), edge tap (~kat~), double central tap, double edge tap and roll. four selectable difficulty levels for each track progressively and considerably increase the required effort: if on ~easy~ the mechanics turn out to be trivial, for purely introductory purposes, and on ~normal~ you get a discrete but widely feasible challenge, passing at the ~hard~ and ~extreme~ grades things get much more complicated and you need to train a lot to get good results. Taiko no Tatsujin: Pop Tap Beat, a roll to be performed with both hands. It is possible to play using a Bluetooth controller and in this way superior precision is perhaps guaranteed, but with touch controls the experience appears decidedly more engaging and cheerful, especially being able to enjoy a large screen like that of the iPad: seeing is believing. In short, if you have already tried any episode of Taiko no Tatsujin you know exactly what to expect. This awareness, applied to mobile devices in such an effective way and without apparent limitations, undoubtedly draws the picture of a successful and exciting product. Technical realization Taiko no Tatsujin: Pop Tap Beat, background details create great atmosphere. An excellent job has also been done in terms of technical implementation, with adjustments that possibly allow to lighten the graphics in order to guarantee perfect audio / video synchronization even on older terminals. Yes, because there is obviously so much to see beyond just the notes that scroll on the screen! The Taiko no Tatsujin series has always been intended as a multi-layered spectacle, fun and challenging for those who play but also fascinating and colorful for those who just observe, in the full spirit of the arcades. Well, Pop Tap Beat is no exception and accompanies the songs that countless animations and moving objects, evocative sequences capable of creating a certain type of atmosphere, all strongly characterized by the nice peculiar style of the franchise. The prizes that can be obtained by grinding high scores within the track list, which unlock very nice aesthetic objects with which to dress up the funny mascot of the game, the cartoonish anthropomorphic drum Don-Chan.
